System¶

System objects manage recycle loops. It takes care of bringing a chemical process to steady state.

class biosteam.System(ID, path, recycle=None, facilities=())[source]¶

Create a System object that can iteratively run each element in a path of BioSTREAM objects until the recycle stream is converged. A path can have function, Unit and/or System objects. When the path contains an inner System object, it converges/solves it in each loop/iteration.

Parameters

  • ID (str) – A unique identification. If ID is None, instance will not be registered in flowsheet.

  • path (tuple[Unit, function and/or System]) – A path that is run element by element until the recycle converges.

  • recycle=None (Stream, optional) – A tear stream for the recycle loop.

  • facilities=() (tuple[Unit, function, and/or System], optional) – Offsite facilities that are simulated only after completing the path simulation.

maxiter = 100¶

Maximum number of iterations

molar_tolerance = 1.0¶

Molar tolerance (kmol/hr)

T_tolerance = 0.1¶

Temperature tolerance (K)

classmethod from_feedstock(ID, feedstock, feeds=None, facilities=(), ends=None)[source]¶

Create a System object from a feedstock.

Parameters

  • ID (str) – Name of system.

  • feedstock (Stream) – Main feedstock of the process.

  • feeds (Iterable[Stream]) – Additional feeds to the process.

  • facilities (Iterable[Facility]) – Offsite facilities that are simulated only after completing the path simulation.

  • ends (Iterable[Stream]) – Streams that not products, but are ultimately specified through process requirements and not by its unit source.

classmethod from_network(ID, network, facilities=())[source]¶

Create a System object from a network.

Parameters

  • ID (str) – Name of system.

  • network (Network) – Network that defines the simulation path.

  • facilities (Iterable[Facility]) – Offsite facilities that are simulated only after completing the path simulation.

property numerical_specification¶

Numerical design or process specification.

save_report(file='report.xlsx', dpi='300', **stream_properties)¶

Save a system report as an xlsx file.

Parameters

  • file (str) – File name to save report

  • **stream_properties (str) – Additional stream properties and units as key-value pairs (e.g. T=’degC’, flow=’gpm’, H=’kW’, etc..)

property TEA¶

[TEA] Object for Techno-Economic Analysis.

property recycle¶

[Stream] A tear stream for the recycle loop

diagram(kind='surface', file=None, format='png', **graph_attrs)[source]¶

Display a Graphviz diagram of the system.

Parameters

  • kind='surface' ({'thorough', 'surface', 'minimal'}:) –

    • ‘thorough’: Display every unit within the path.

    • ’surface’: Display only elements listed in the path.

    • ’minimal’: Display path as a box.

  • file=None (str, display in console by default) – File name to save diagram.

  • format='png' (str) – File format (e.g. “png”, “svg”).

reset_names(unit_format=None, stream_format=None)[source]¶

Reset names of all streams and units according to the path order.

reset_flows()[source]¶

Reset all process streams to zero flow.

simulate()[source]¶

Converge the path and simulate all units.

debug()[source]¶

Converge in debug mode. Just try it!

show()[source]¶

Prints information on unit.

property ID¶

Unique identification (str). If set as ‘’, it will choose a default ID.
